thread.title: New Report: Melania Trump Might Continue Living In NYC
thread.title_full: New Report: Melania Trump Might Continue Living In NYC

title: New Report: Melania Trump Might Continue Living In NYC

organizations.name: melania trump might continue living in nyc   previously

text:
Previously announced plans for first lady Melania Trump to move to the White House when this school year ends may be up in the air, according to a new report.
Relying upon information provided by what it called “a family insider,” Us magazine said President Donald Trump and his wife will decide later this spring whether the family will all be together in Washington or remain separated.
“They will reevaluate toward the end of the school year if they will keep this arrangement or if Melania and Barron will move to Washington,” the magazine reported the source as saying. “They could go either way right now. They will ultimately do what’s best for Barron.”
  Senate Confirms Former Exxon CEO Tillerson As Secretary Of State Trump Tweets Photo Of Prayer After Gorsuch Announcement 2 GOP Senators Vow To Oppose DeVos On Senate Floor In the aftermath of the November election, the Trumps announced that Melania would remain in New York City so that Barron, their 10-year-old son, could complete his year of school.
That arrangement means that Melania and Barron Trump visit the White House on weekends. However, they did not visit the president this past weekend.
When asked whether he was lonely without his family, Trump has said, “No, because I end up working longer. And that’s OK.”
 
Although where Melania lives may be uncertain, she is moving forward to lay the groundwork for an active role as first lady, the magazine reported.
“While she is a mom first, she is very much embracing the role and responsibilities of first lady,” it said.
Melania Trump has begun building a staff, hiring Stephanie Winston Wolkoff as a senior adviser.
Some reports have indicated she will also take an aggressive tone in response to social media attacks on her family.
  Obama’s Statement Supporting Protests Of Trump’s Executive Order Ticks Off MSNBC Host 2 GOP Senators Vow To Oppose DeVos On Senate Floor Trump Cancels Signing Of Cybersecurity Executive Order Last week, she won a victory in her $150 million defamation case against the Daily Mail and a Maryland blogger when a judge refused their request to have the case dismissed. The news organization and blogger William Tarpley had argued that the comments published about Melania Trump alleging she was a high-end escort did not meet the standard of “actual malice” required for public figures.
Judge Sharon Burrell disagreed.
“The court believes most people, when they hear the words ‘high-end escort’ that describes a prostitute. There could be no more defamatory statement than to call a woman a prostitute,” Burrell wrote in her decision.
What do you think?
